ground_truth: A cassette labeled Soul Funk number two plays on the stereo as Whip lies back with a pack of ice on his knee. He picks up a glass of whiskey as Nicole, fresh from taking a shower, exits the bathroom. She picks up a cushion and, carrying the pillow, walks to Whip, kneels down beside him, and removes the ice pack from his knee. She lifts his leg and places the cushion under it and massages his knee. Whip is laid back in the armchair watching as Nicole's hands move up to cover his hand. He raises the glass as if to take a drink but stops midway. Nicole hesitates, her gaze steady on him; then she takes the glass from his hand and sets it carefully on the nearby table. She pushes herself towards him and they kiss. They look into each other's eyes and their lips meet again. The next morning Whip watches Nicole as she briefly stirs in her sleep; then Whip looks up and rises off the bed. Outside, Hugh gets out of a car. Whip steps onto the veranda holding his cane and a gun. Hugh partially raises his hands. Hugh and Whip climb a platform near the church where a small congregation listens to a sermon in a cordoned off area. Hugh takes a pair of binoculars and watches a woman step out of a black SUV. Whip watches as reporters and officials wander around the wreckage and then clenches his jaw. Carr stands at the far end of the large conference table opposite Charlie, then pushes through the double glass doors and walks towards Whip, who stands. Whip forces a smile and drinks straight from a whiskey bottle. He watches a home video of his father and son playing football. Nicole walks in the door and watches him. He increases the volume on the TV. Nicole has not moved since she walked in and watches Whip try to stand, and then, fall. He lies prone on the carpet; Nicole covers her mouth with her hand as Whip has passed out. Nicole removes the cigarette from his fingers and adjusts his head so he can breathe easily. Nicole covers Whip with a blanket, then turns off the video and switches off the light. Nicole sits in a chair on the veranda taking pictures as Whip steps out in a bathrobe and ambles toward her. He sits in a rocking chair, smiles at her, places a cigarette in his mouth and picks up her camera. He picks up a book from the coffee table between them, points to some open land, and Nicole puffs on her cigarette and nods. Whip points the camera at her. At a church, a large framed picture of Katerina stands surrounded by flowers as a coffin is carried out.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A tape tagged Soul Funk number two plays on the sound system as Whip reclines back with a bag of ice on his knee. He lifts up a tumbler of whiskey as Nicole, fresh from taking a shower, emerges from the restroom. She lifts up a cushion and, holding the pillow, walks to Whip, kneels down beside him, and removes the ice bag from his knee. She elevates his leg and places the cushion beneath it and massages his knee. Whip is reclined back in the armchair observing as Nicole's hands move up to cover his hand. He raises the tumbler as if to take a sip but halts halfway. Nicole pauses, her gaze steady on him; then she takes the tumbler from his hand and sets it cautiously on the nearby table. She pushes herself towards him and they kiss. They look into each other's eyes and their lips meet again. The next morning Whip observes Nicole as she briefly stirs in her slumber; then Whip looks up and rises off the bed. Outside, Hugh exits a vehicle. Whip steps onto the porch holding his cane and a firearm. Hugh partially raises his hands. Hugh and Whip ascend a platform near the church where a small assembly listens to a homily in a restricted area. Hugh takes a pair of field glasses and observes a woman step out of a black SUV. Whip observes as journalists and officials roam around the debris and then clenches his jaw. Carr stands at the far end of the large conference table opposite Charlie, then pushes through the double glass doors and walks towards Whip, who stands. Whip forces a grin and drinks straight from a whiskey bottle. He observes a home video of his father and son playing football. Nicole walks in the door and observes him. He increases the volume on the TV. Nicole has not moved since she walked in and observes Whip try to stand, and then, fall. He lies prone on the carpet; Nicole covers her mouth with her hand as Whip has passed out. Nicole removes the cigarette from his fingers and adjusts his head so he can breathe easily. Nicole covers Whip with a blanket, then turns off the video and switches off the light. Nicole sits in a chair on the porch taking pictures as Whip steps out in a bathrobe and ambles toward her. He sits in a rocking chair, grins at her, places a cigarette in his mouth and lifts up her camera. He lifts up a book from the coffee table between them, points to some open land, and Nicole puffs on her cigarette and nods. Whip points the camera at her. At a church, a large framed photo of Katerina stands surrounded by flowers as a casket is carried out.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A cassette labeled Soul Funk number two is played on the stereo as Whip is laid back with a pack of ice on his knee. A glass of whiskey is picked up by him as Nicole, fresh from taking a shower, exits the bathroom. A cushion is picked up by her, and, carrying the pillow, she walks to Whip, kneels down beside him, and removes the ice pack from his knee. His leg is lifted by her and the cushion is placed under it as she massages his knee. Whip lies back in the armchair watching as Nicole's hands move up to cover his hand. The glass is raised by him as if to take a drink but stops midway. Nicole hesitates, her gaze steady on him; then she takes the glass from his hand and sets it carefully on the nearby table. She pushes herself toward him and a kiss is shared between them. They look into each other's eyes and their lips meet again. The next morning Nicole is watched by Whip as she briefly stirs in her sleep; then he looks up and rises off the bed. Outside, a car is exited by Hugh. The veranda is stepped onto by Whip holding his cane and a gun. Hugh partially raises his hands. Hugh and Whip climb a platform near the church where a small congregation listens to a sermon in a cordoned off area. A pair of binoculars is taken by Hugh and he watches a woman step out of a black SUV. Reporters and officials are watched by Whip as they wander around the wreckage and then he clenches his jaw. At the far end of the large conference table opposite Charlie stands Carr, then she pushes through the double glass doors and walks towards Whip, who stands. A smile is forced by Whip and he drinks straight from a whiskey bottle. A home video of his father and son playing football is watched by him. Nicole walks in the door and watches him. The volume on the TV is increased by him. Nicole has not moved since she walked in and watches Whip try to stand, and then, fall. He lies prone on the carpet; Nicole covers her mouth with her hand as he has passed out. The cigarette is removed by Nicole from his fingers and his head is adjusted so he can breathe easily. Whip is covered with a blanket by Nicole, then the video is turned off and the light is switched off. A chair on the veranda is sat in by Nicole taking pictures as Whip steps out in a bathrobe and ambles toward her. A rocking chair is sat in by him, he smiles at her, places a cigarette in his mouth and her camera is picked up. A book is picked up by him from the coffee table between them, he points to some open land, and Nicole puffs on her cigarette and nods. The camera is pointed at her by Whip. At a church, a large framed picture of Katerina stands surrounded by flowers as a coffin is carried out.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: A cassette labeled Soul Funk number two plays as Whip reclines with ice on his knee. Holding a whiskey, he watches Nicole exit the shower. She picks up a cushion, kneels beside him, removes the ice, and massages his knee. Whip watches her hands cover his, raising the glass but stopping. Nicole takes the glass, sets it aside, then kisses him. They gaze at each other and kiss again. The next morning, Whip watches Nicole stir, then gets up. Outside, Hugh exits a car. Whip steps onto the veranda with a cane and gun. Hugh raises his hands, and they climb a platform near the church. Hugh uses binoculars to watch a woman exit a black SUV; Whip sees reporters around the wreckage and clenches his jaw. Carr approaches Whip at a conference table, who forces a smile and drinks whiskey. Watching a home video of his father and son, Nicole enters and observes him. Whip tries to stand but falls, passing out. Nicole removes the cigarette from his fingers, adjusts his head for easy breathing, covers him with a blanket, and turns off the video and light. On the veranda, Nicole takes pictures as Whip, in a bathrobe, joins her in a rocking chair. He smiles, takes her camera, and points it at her after gesturing to open land. At a church, Katerina's large framed picture is surrounded by flowers as a coffin is carried out.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: A cassette labeled Soul Funk number two plays as Whip lies back with ice on his knee, holding whiskey. Nicole, fresh from a shower, kneels beside him, removes the ice, places a cushion under his leg, and massages his knee. She takes the whiskey glass from Whip, sets it aside, and they kiss. The next morning, Whip rises from bed and steps onto the veranda with a cane and gun, as Hugh exits a car. Whip watches a woman from a black SUV via binoculars and sees reporters near wreckage. Carr approaches Whip at a conference table. Whip drinks from a whiskey bottle while watching a video of his father and son. Nicole enters, watches Whip fall and pass out, removes his cigarette, and covers him with a blanket. On the veranda, Nicole takes photos as Whip smiles, smokes, and points a camera at her. At a church, a large framed picture of Katerina is surrounded by flowers as a coffin is carried out.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: A cassette prominently labeled as Soul Funk number two plays melodiously on the stereo system while Whip reclines comfortably with a soothing pack of ice placed on his injured knee. As he settles in, he reaches out to pick up a glass filled with whiskey. At that moment, Nicole, who is fresh and rejuvenated from taking an invigorating shower, emerges from the bathroom. She picks up a soft cushion and, while holding the pillow, makes her way over to Whip. She kneels down gently beside him, attentively removes the cold ice pack from his knee, and lifts his leg to place the cushion carefully underneath it. With deliberate movements, she begins to massage his knee. Whip, relaxed and laid back in the armchair, observes her hands as they skillfully move up to cover his hand with a tender touch. He raises his glass as though he intends to take a sip, but pauses halfway through the motion. Nicole stops momentarily, her eyes fixed steadily on him; then, with care, she takes the glass from his hand and places it gently on the nearby table. She leans toward him, and they share a passionate kiss. Their eyes meet, looking deeply into each other's, and their lips come together once more in a tender embrace. The following morning, as Whip watches, Nicole stirs briefly in her sleep, and then Whip, gathering himself, looks up and rises from the bed. Outside, Hugh is seen getting out of a car. Whip steps out onto the veranda, holding both his cane and a gun with a firm grip. Hugh raises his hands partially in a gesture of acknowledgment. Together, Hugh and Whip make their way up to a platform situated near a church where a small congregation gathers to listen to a sermon within a cordoned off area. Hugh, with intent, takes a pair of binoculars and observes a woman stepping out of a sleek black SUV. Whip watches intently as reporters and officials move around the scene of the wreckage, and then he clenches his jaw tightly. Carr stands at the opposite end of the expansive conference table from Charlie, then pushes through the double glass doors, walking toward Whip, who stands up in response. Whip forces a smile and takes a drink directly from a whiskey bottle. He immerses himself in watching a home video displaying his father and son playing football together. Nicole enters the room quietly, observing him. As she watches, he increases the volume on the television. Nicole remains still since she walked in, watching as Whip attempts to stand but then falls. He collapses and lies prone on the carpet. With concern, Nicole covers her mouth with her hand, realizing that Whip has passed out. She takes the cigarette from his fingers and carefully adjusts his head so that he can breathe easily. Nicole then tenderly covers Whip with a blanket, turns off the video, and switches off the light. Sitting on a chair on the veranda, Nicole takes photographs as Whip emerges in a bathrobe and ambles leisurely toward her. He settles into a rocking chair, smiles warmly at her, places a cigarette in his mouth, and picks up her camera. He retrieves a book from the coffee table situated between them, gestures toward some open land, and Nicole puffs on her cigarette while nodding in agreement. Whip points the camera at her with a playful gesture. At the church, a large framed photograph of Katerina stands surrounded by an arrangement of flowers, as a coffin is solemnly carried out.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: A cassette that is prominently marked as "Soul Funk Number Two" plays melodiously on the stereo system, filling the room with the rhythmic tunes of soulful funk music, while Whip reclines comfortably, finding relief with a soothing pack of ice placed carefully on his injured knee. As he settles into his relaxed position, he reaches out with a steady hand to pick up a glass filled with whiskey, intending to enjoy this moment of tranquility. At that very instant, Nicole, who is feeling fresh and rejuvenated after taking an invigorating shower, emerges gracefully from the bathroom. She picks up a soft, plush cushion, and while holding this pillow close, she makes her way over to where Whip is seated. She kneels down gently and attentively beside him, carefully removing the cold ice pack from his knee, and then she lifts his leg with care to place the cushion softly underneath it. With deliberate and gentle movements, she begins to massage his knee with a soothing touch. Whip, in a relaxed and laid-back manner, sits back in the armchair and observes intently as her hands begin to skillfully move up and cover his hand with a tender touch. He raises his glass as if preparing to take a sip of whiskey but pauses halfway through the motion. Nicole momentarily stops, her eyes fixed steadily on him, and then, with thoughtful care, she takes the glass from his hand and places it gently on the nearby table. She leans in toward him, and they share a passionate kiss. Their eyes meet, locking onto each other's gaze, and their lips come together once more in a tender embrace filled with intimacy. The following morning, as Whip watches over her, Nicole stirs briefly in her sleep, and then Whip, gathering himself and collecting his thoughts, looks up and rises slowly from the bed. Outside, Hugh is seen getting out of a car in a casual yet purposeful manner. Whip steps out onto the veranda, holding both his sturdy cane and a gun with a firm, determined grip. Hugh raises his hands partially in a gesture of acknowledgment and familiarity. Together, Hugh and Whip make their way up to a platform situated near a church where a small congregation of people gathers to listen to a sermon within a cordoned-off area. Hugh, with a focused intent, takes a pair of binoculars and observes a woman stepping elegantly out of a sleek black SUV. Whip watches intently, his gaze fixed as reporters and officials move around the busy scene of the wreckage. He then clenches his jaw tightly, filled with emotion and determination. Carr stands at the opposite end of the expansive conference table from Charlie, then pushes through the double glass doors, walking purposefully toward Whip, who stands up in response to his approach. Whip forces a smile and takes a drink directly from a whiskey bottle, immersing himself in the comforting yet bittersweet act of watching a home video displaying his father and son playing football together. Nicole enters the room quietly, observing him with a sense of concern and care. As she watches, he increases the volume on the television, lost in the memories. Nicole remains still since she first walked in, watching as Whip attempts to stand but then falters. He collapses and lies prone on the carpet, his body heavy with the weight of his struggles. With a look of deep concern, Nicole covers her mouth with her hand, realizing that Whip has passed out. She takes the cigarette delicately from his fingers and carefully adjusts his head so that he can breathe easily. Nicole then tenderly covers Whip with a comforting blanket, turns off the video, and switches off the light, enveloping the room in quiet darkness. Sitting on a chair on the veranda, Nicole takes photographs, capturing moments as Whip emerges in a bathrobe and ambles leisurely toward her. He settles into a rocking chair, offers a warm smile in her direction, places a cigarette in his mouth, and picks up her camera with a playful gesture. He retrieves a book from the coffee table situated between them, gestures toward some open land with a casual nod, and Nicole puffs on her cigarette while nodding in agreement. Whip points the camera at her in a playful manner, capturing the lighthearted moment. At the church, a large framed photograph of Katerina stands surrounded by an arrangement of beautiful flowers, as a coffin is solemnly carried out, marking a moment of somber reflection.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: A cassette labeled Soul Funk number two plays softly on the stereo, creating a soothing atmosphere as Whip reclines in an armchair, his knee elevated with a pack of ice resting atop it. He reaches out and carefully lifts a glass of whiskey, feeling its coolness against his palm just as Nicole, fresh and invigorated from her shower, emerges from the bathroom. With a decisive motion, she picks up a cushion and carries it over to where Whip is resting. Kneeling beside him, she gently removes the ice pack from his knee and, with practiced care, lifts his leg to position the cushion beneath it, providing extra comfort and support. Her hands move with deliberate intention as she begins to massage his knee, easing the tension there. Whip watches her attentively, lying back in the armchair, as Nicole's hands work their way up to gently cover his hand. He raises the glass, poised to take a sip of whiskey, but pauses in contemplation. Nicole's gaze is fixed on him, unwavering, and after a moment of shared silence, she takes the glass from his hand, placing it deliberately on the nearby table. Leaning closer, she pushes herself toward him, and their lips meet in a tender kiss. Their eyes lock for a brief, intimate moment before they kiss once more, sealing their connection. The next morning, as light filters softly into the room, Whip watches peacefully as Nicole stirs briefly in her sleep, then he quietly rises from the bed. Outside, Hugh steps out of a car with purpose. Whip emerges onto the veranda, his cane in one hand and a gun in the other, his presence commanding. Hugh raises his hands partially, signaling a gesture of placation. Together, Hugh and Whip ascend a platform near the church, where a small congregation is gathered, listening intently to a sermon within a cordoned-off space. Hugh, with a focused eye, lifts a pair of binoculars to watch a woman stepping out of a black SUV nearby. Meanwhile, Whip observes the chaotic scene of reporters and officials milling around the site of wreckage, his jaw tightening with a mix of emotions. Inside, in a more solemn setting, Carr stands at the far end of a large conference table, facing Charlie, then pushes resolutely through a pair of double glass doors, walking directly towards Whip, who stands in anticipation. Whip forces a smile, concealing his inner turmoil, and takes a swig directly from a whiskey bottle, the liquid burning slightly as it goes down. He then turns his attention to a home video playing on the television, a nostalgic scene of his father and son playing football, a reflection of simpler times. As the video continues, Nicole walks in quietly, her presence a steady comfort. Whip increases the volume on the TV, seeking perhaps a louder distraction from his thoughts. Nicole, still standing near the door, watches Whip closely as he attempts to stand, only to lose his balance and fall heavily onto the carpet, succumbing to unconsciousness. She covers her mouth with her hand, witnessing his vulnerability as he passes out. With gentle care, Nicole removes the cigarette precariously dangling from his fingers and adjusts his head to ensure he can breathe easy, turning him slightly. Once satisfied, she drapes a blanket over his prone form, offering warmth and protection before turning off the video, the noise replaced by silence as she switches off the light, casting the room into darkness. Later, Nicole sits composedly in a chair on the veranda, capturing moments with her camera as Whip steps out, wrapped in the comfort of a bathrobe, and ambles toward her, each step measured and deliberate. Settling into a rocking chair beside her, he offers a warm smile and places a cigarette between his lips, feeling the weight of her camera as he picks it up to examine it. Reaching for a book from the coffee table situated between them, he gestures with it towards some open land, indicating possibilities. Nicole acknowledges his gesture with a slow nod, exhaling smoke from her cigarette. Whip lifts the camera, aiming it at her, framing her through the lens. In a different setting, at a church, a large framed picture of Katerina stands solemnly surrounded by an array of flowers, an homage to her memory. As gentle mourners gather, a coffin is respectfully carried out, marking a poignant moment of farewell.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: A cassette labeled Soul Funk number two plays on the stereo as Whip relaxes with an ice pack on his knee and a glass of whiskey in hand. After her shower, Nicole exits the bathroom, picks up a cushion, and kneels beside Whip to replace the ice pack under his leg with the cushion, massaging his knee. As Whip considers sipping his whiskey, Nicole takes the glass from him, sets it aside, and they share a kiss, looking into each other's eyes before kissing again. The next morning, Whip watches Nicole stir briefly in her sleep before getting out of bed. Outside, he emerges onto the veranda with his cane and a gun as Hugh steps out of a car. They ascend a platform near the church, where a sermon is being delivered to a small congregation. Using binoculars, Hugh observes a woman exiting a black SUV, while Whip watches the reporters and officials at the wreckage site and clenches his jaw. At the large conference table, Carr confronts Charlie and then approaches Whip, who forces a smile and drinks from a whiskey bottle, watching a home video of his father and son playing football. Nicole enters, watching as Whip attempts to stand and falls, passing out. She removes the cigarette from his fingers, adjusts his head, covers him with a blanket, and turns off the video and lights. Later, on the veranda, Nicole takes pictures as Whip joins her in a bathrobe, sits in a rocking chair, smiles, and examines her camera. He picks up a book, indicates some land, and they share a moment of understanding. At the church, a large framed picture of Katerina stands amidst flowers as a coffin is carried out.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: A cassette labeled Soul Funk number two, a popular genre that emerged in the 1970s combining elements of African American gospel and rhythm and blues, plays on the stereo as Whip lies back with a pack of ice on his knee, a remedy often used to reduce swelling. He picks up a glass of whiskey, a spirit distilled from fermented grain mash, as Nicole, fresh from taking a shower that she took to relax after a long day, exits the bathroom. She picks up a cushion from the sofa, a decorative item often used for comfort, and, carrying the pillow, walks to Whip, kneels down beside him, and removes the ice pack from his knee. She lifts his leg, which had been injured in an unforeseen incident, and places the cushion under it and massages his knee to soothe the discomfort. Whip is laid back in the armchair, a piece of furniture designed for relaxation, watching as Nicole's hands move up to cover his hand. He raises the glass as if to take a drink but stops midway, concerned about the effect it might have on his knee. Nicole hesitates, her gaze steady on him; then she takes the glass from his hand, aware of the possible harm, and sets it carefully on the nearby table. She pushes herself towards him, a moment charged with emotion, and they kiss. They look into each other's eyes, a silent communication of shared feelings, and their lips meet again. The next morning, Whip watches Nicole as she briefly stirs in her sleep; then Whip looks up, reflecting on the past events, and rises off the bed. Outside, Hugh gets out of a car, a vehicle distinguished by its sleek, modern design. Whip steps onto the veranda, holding his cane, which aids his mobility, and a gun, reflecting the tension of the moment. Hugh partially raises his hands in a gesture of peace. Hugh and Whip climb a platform near the church, a place of worship often serving as a community center, where a small congregation listens to a sermon, a religious discourse, in a cordoned off area. Hugh takes a pair of binoculars, a tool for magnified viewing, and watches a woman step out of a black SUV, a sport utility vehicle known for its robustness. Whip watches as reporters and officials, integral to publicizing and managing crises, wander around the wreckage and then clenches his jaw in frustration. Carr stands at the far end of the large conference table, designed for meetings and discussions, opposite Charlie, then pushes through the double glass doors and walks towards Whip, who stands, ready to confront the situation. Whip forces a smile, a facade masking his inner turmoil, and drinks straight from a whiskey bottle, seeking solace in its temporary oblivion. He watches a home video of his father and son playing football, a beloved pastime in their family. Nicole walks in the door and watches him, aware of the significance of the moment. He increases the volume on the TV to drown out his thoughts. Nicole has not moved since she walked in and watches Whip try to stand, unsteady from the effects of alcohol, and then, fall. He lies prone on the carpet; Nicole covers her mouth with her hand, shocked as Whip has passed out. Nicole removes the cigarette from his fingers, mindful of the fire hazard, and adjusts his head so he can breathe easily, using her nursing skills. Nicole covers Whip with a blanket, then turns off the video and switches off the light, ensuring a peaceful environment. Nicole sits in a chair on the veranda, a space often used for relaxation, taking pictures as Whip steps out in a bathrobe, a garment typically worn for comfort, and ambles toward her. He sits in a rocking chair, an icon of comfort and nostalgia, smiles at her, places a cigarette in his mouth and picks up her camera, a tool for capturing memories. He picks up a book from the coffee table between them, suggesting a shared interest, points to some open land, possibly discussing future plans, and Nicole puffs on her cigarette and nods. Whip points the camera at her, capturing the moment. At a church, a large framed picture of Katerina, whose life was tragically cut short, stands surrounded by flowers as a coffin is carried out, marking the solemn occasion of her funeral.

Hugh and Whip climb a platform near the church where a small congregation listens to a sermon in a cordoned off area. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Hugh takes a pair of binoculars and watches a woman step out of a black SUV. Whip watches as reporters and officials wander around the wreckage and then clenches his jaw. Carr stands at the far end of the large conference table opposite. Charlie then pushes through the double glass doors and walks towards Whip who stands. Whip forces a smile and drinks straight from a whiskey bottle. He watches a home video of his father and son playing football. Nicole walks in the door and watches him. He increases the volume on the TV. Nicole has not moved since. she walked in and watches Whip try to stand and then fall. He lies prone on the carpet. Nicole covers her mouth with her hand as Whip has passed out. Nicole removes the cigarette from his fingers and adjusts his head so he can breathe easily. Nicole covers Whip with a blanket then turns off the video and switches off the light. Nicole sits in a chair on the veranda taking pictures as Whip steps out in a bathrobe and ambles toward her. He sits in a rocking chair smiles at her places a cigarette in his mouth and picks up her camera. He picks up a book from the coffee table between them points to some open land and Nicole puffs on her cigarette and nods. Whip points the camera at her. At a church a large framed picture of Katerina stands surrounded by flowers as a coffin is carried out.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: A cassette labeled Soul Funk number two plays on the stereo as Whip lies back with a pack of ice on his knee. He picks up a glass of whiskey as Nicole fresh from taking a shower exits the bathroom. She picks up a cushion and carrying the pillow walks to. Whip kneels down beside him and removes the ice pack from his knee. She lifts his leg and places the cushion under it and massages his knee. Whip is laid back in the armchair watching as Nicole's hands move up to cover his hand. He raises the glass as if to take a drink but stops midway. Nicole hesitates her gaze steady on him. then she takes the glass from his hand and sets it carefully on the nearby table. she walked in and watches Whip try to stand and then fall. He lies prone on the carpet. Nicole covers her mouth with her hand as Whip has passed out. Nicole removes the cigarette from his fingers and adjusts his head so he can breathe easily. Nicole covers Whip with a blanket then turns off the video and switches off the light. Nicole sits in a chair on the veranda taking pictures as Whip steps out in a bathrobe and ambles toward her. He sits in a rocking chair smiles at her places a cigarette in his mouth and picks up her camera. He picks up a book from the coffee table between them points to some open land and Nicole puffs on her cigarette and nods. Whip points the camera at her. At a church a large framed picture of Katerina stands surrounded by flowers as a coffin is carried out.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A vinyl labeled Jazz Groove number eight spins on the gramophone as Rover reclines with a stack of books on his elbow. He grabs a mug of lemonade as Diana, fresh from pruning the garden, enters the kitchen. She picks up a lamp and, clutching the lampshade, strides to Rover, crouches beside him, and tosses the books from his elbow. She elevates his arm and positions the lamp under it and tickles his elbow. Rover is sprawled in the hammock observing as Diana's fingers drift up to pinch his toe. He raises the mug as if to sip the drink but halts midway. Diana wavers, her gaze fixed on him; then she snatches the mug from his grip and places it gently on the adjacent chair. She leans towards him and they hug. They gaze into each other's faces and their foreheads touch again. The following afternoon Rover observes Diana as she softly turns in her nap; then Rover glances around and rolls off the mattress. Inside, Frank climbs out of a bicycle. Rover strolls onto the patio wielding his umbrella and a clock. Frank partially lowers his feet. Frank and Rover ascend a ladder near the bakery where a small audience listens to a lecture in a separated section. Frank grabs a pair of sunglasses and observes a cat jump out of a red truck. Rover observes as tourists and bystanders amble around the sculpture and then furrows his brow. Sam stands at the far edge of the large dining table opposite Jordan, then slides through the revolving wooden doors and marches towards Rover, who sits. Rover forces a grin and gulps straight from a lemonade can. He watches a silent film of his uncle and nephew gardening. Diana marches in the doorway and observes him. He cranks up the sound on the radio. Diana has not shifted since she entered and observes Rover attempt to rise, and then, stumble. He sprawls face down on the tile; Diana covers her mouth with her fingers as Rover has dozed off. Diana removes the pen from his lips and adjusts his torso so he can breathe smoothly. Diana drapes Rover with a quilt, then turns off the film and dims the lamp. Diana perches in a hammock on the porch sketching drawings as Rover shuffles out in a hoodie and saunters toward her. He settles in a glider, grins at her, places a pen in his ear and seizes her sketchpad. He grabs a hat from the coffee table beside them, gestures to some vacant street, and Diana inhales on her pen and agrees. Rover aims the sketchpad at her. At a bakery, a huge painted image of Matilda rests surrounded by cupcakes as a statue is wheeled in.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Whip relaxes with an ice pack on his knee and whiskey in hand as Nicole, fresh from a shower, tends to him, setting his leg on a cushion and massaging his knee. They share a moment of intimacy, resulting in a tender kiss. The next morning, Whip rises from bed while Nicole sleeps. Outside, Whip joins Hugh as they head to a platform near a church where a sermon is being delivered. They watch a woman from a distance, noting the presence of reporters around the wreckage. Later, Whip is seen drinking whiskey while watching a home video until he collapses, with Nicole tenderly ensuring his comfort. On the veranda, Whip and Nicole share a quiet moment, capturing photos together. At a church, a ceremony takes place with Katerina's framed photo surrounded by flowers as a coffin is carried out.
